paper.title: Properties of Geographic Data: Requirements for Spatial Access Methods
paper.venue: SSD '91 Proceedings of the Second International Symposium on Advances in Spatial Databases
paper.abstract: Spatial access methods and the corresponding data structures are necessary to achieve the expected overall performance of Geographic Information System (GIS) and are currently a prominent topic for research in spatial databases. Their performance is influenced by the properties of spatial data. This paper details the specific properties of spatial data in a Geographic Information system. It concentrates on Geographic Information Systems that store data describing objects with a distinct identity and does exclude image and remote sensing databases from consideration â€” given that the characteristics of the data are very different.
